sentences.en: An occasional glass of wine was his only indulgence.
sentences.cn: 偶尔喝杯葡萄酒是他唯一的嗜好。

sentences.en: Experiencing life does not mean depravity and indulgence.
sentences.cn: 体验生活并不意味着堕落和放纵。

sentences.en: For a moment he allowed himself the indulgence of examining his feelings for her.
sentences.cn: 有那么一会儿他让自己沉下心来仔细分析一下对她的感情。

sentences.en: He attacked the indulgence shown to religious dissenters.
sentences.cn: 他抨击对宗教上持不同政见者表现出的宽容.

sentences.en: He did not normally permit himself the indulgence of sentiment.
sentences.cn: 他一般不允许自己陷入感情的罗网.

sentences.en: He prayed to be saved from self-indulgence.
sentences.cn: 他祈祷自己能从自我放纵中摆脱出来。

sentences.en: Her indulgence to her children was bad for them.
sentences.cn: 她溺爱自己的孩子,这对他们不好.

sentences.en: Indulgence in smoking can seriously harm your health.
sentences.cn: 抽烟过度会严重损害你的健康.

sentences.en: She allowed herself only a few moments'indulgence in self - pity.
sentences.cn: 她只许自己自哀自怜了几分钟.
糖是我最喜欢吃的东西.

sentences.en: The king's indulgence toward his sons angered the business community.
sentences.cn: 国王对孩子们的纵容激怒了商界。

sentences.en: The king's indulgence towards his sons angered the business community.
sentences.cn: 国王对儿子们的纵容令商界恼火。

sentences.en: The old man demanded indulgence as his due.
sentences.cn: 老人要求别人应迁就他.

sentences.en: This indulgence was in accordance with the general policy of the redmen.
sentences.cn: 这种宽宏大量的气度,是红种人一贯使用的策略.

sentences.en: to lead a life of indulgence
You will kill the child with indulgence.

words.tran_cn: 满足；纵容；使高兴；使沉迷于…

trans.tran_cn: 沉溺，迁就，宽容，嗜好，溺爱，放纵
trans.tran_en: the habit of allowing yourself to do or have whatever you want, or allowing someone else to do or have whatever they want
